ygData.subject: Question on SURT prefixes and URI canonicalization
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi all, Am I correct in assuming that URI canonicalization has nothing to do with SURT prefix comparisons, such that the removal of www variants happens

Subject: Question on SURT prefixes and URI canonicalization
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=6903103; y=16qOEIrtBPXbUxApJZkSN-50hE7H7FmWpgCc_5_k87M0xmdY

Hi all,

Am I correct in assuming that URI canonicalization has nothing to do
with SURT prefix comparisons, such that the removal of "www" variants
happens later in the process and that the scope just sees the complete
URL?

Also, let's say I have a seed like

http://www2.dw-world.de/pashto

Where I want to restrict all crawling to just paths under pashto. The SURT

http://(de,dw-world,www2,)/pashto

will do this. But what if the 'www2' could change to 'www' or 'www3'
during the crawl? In that case the prefix fails to match and I'm SOL,
right?

Presumably

http://(de,dw-world,)/pashto

will not work?

Thx.

   -tree
